div1.head: Letter from George Miller Sternberg to the Adjutant General, July 29, 1898
div1.opener:
Communications on official business should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Administration of Hospitals, Investigation of
In reply refer to No.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
Washington, July 29, 1898.
To the
ADJUTANT GENERAL OF THE ARMY,
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to recommend that Major Walter Reed, Surgeon,
U. S. Army, and an Officer to be designated by the War Department, may
be ordered to proceed to the following named places for the purpose of
making a thorough investigation with reference to the administration
of the United States General Hospitals and Division Field Hospitals,
namely; to Camp Alger, Virginia: to Fort Thomas, Kentucky: to Camp
Thomas, Georgia; to Fort McPherson, Georgia, and to Fort Monroe, Virginia.
div1.closer: Very respectfully, Geo. M. Sternberg Surgeon General, U. S. Army.

div1.head: Special Orders, No. 178, July 30, 1898
div1.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, July 30, 1898.

40. Major Walter Reed, surgeon, U. S. Army, and Major
George H. Hopkins, Assistant Adjutant General, U. S. Vol-
unteers, will proceed to Camp Russell A. Alger, Virginia,
Fort Thomas, Kentucky, Camp George H. Thomas and Fort
McPherson, Georgia, and Fort Monroe, Virginia, and make a
thorough investigation of the administration of the U. S.
General Hospitals and Division Field Hospitals located at
those places, and, on completion thereof, will return to their
proper station in this city. The travel enjoined is necessary
for the public service.

BY ORDER OF THE SECRETARY OF WAR:
H. C. CORBIN,
Adjutant General.
